title: Is there any cover song in YouTube that got more viewers than the original? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Blues Brothers' recording of "Soul Man" peaks out currently at 11,808,765 views, while the original by Sam and Dave has only 484,064. These are the highest counts on an individual version displayed on YouTube, not the total of views, but the ratios are about the same. Many R&B/Soul/Blues songs that were originally recorded by black artists have been "covered" by white artists and found more popularity with the 'general public' going all the way back to Elvis Presley covering Arthur Crudup's "That's Alright, Mama." (Thanks for asking, Shakil.)

"I Will Always Love You" (Dolly Parton original=15.8 million, Whitney Houston cover official video=177.4 million)"Mack the Knife" (Lotte Lenya original in German=587 thousand, Bobby Darin cover=4.3 million)"The Twist" (Hank Ballard & the Midnighters original=90 thousand, Chubby Checker cover=8.4 million)"Unchained Melody" (original instrumental by Les Baxter & His Orchestra=78 thousand, cover by the Righteous Brothers with lyrics added=38.6 million)
